newsitem.title: UK: UK Fraud Office starts Deutsche Morgan probe.
newsitem.headline: UK Fraud Office starts Deutsche Morgan probe.

text.p: Britain's Serious Fraud Office (SFO) said on Saturday it had started an investigation into the conduct of a former senior investment manager at Deutsche Morgan Grenfell.
The SFO said in a statement that is had caried out a serach warrant at the home of the former manager, Peter Young. It said no-one had been arrested.
The SFO, which investigates and prosecutes major financial crimes, has been watching since irregularities were first exposed in three Morgan Grenfell Asset Management (MGAM) funds four weeks ago.

Trading in the MGAM funds was temporarily suspended earlier this month but resumed after a 180 million pound ($281 million) cash injection by Germany's Deutsche Bank. Deutsche Morgan Grenfell is the London fund management arm of Deutsche Bank.
Last week MGAM sacked Young on grounds of alleged gross misconduct.
Young, 38, has said he is being made a scapegoat. His lawyers have said there are no grounds for allegations of criminality against him.
